ratings.comment: WORST. LECTURER. EVER. If you think you'll understand something, well... think again my friend. she explains the content like she is explaining it to herself. Handwriting isn't good either. Discussions aren't that helpful. You'd be better off understanding the material from Khan Academy or something.

Should rename class to How to be a terrible professor 101 Professor Li is an expert on showing up late, illegible handwriting, and presenting material in the least understandable way possible. If you are interested in these topics take this class!
Cant understand a word she says. Ocassionally late for lecture. She doesnt use microphone. I cant understand her handwriting. Worst professor Ive ever had.

Without a doubt the worst professor/lecturer/instructor I've had at UW. She's awful. Less than a third of students came to lectures because there was no point. She was impossible to understand, and her handwriting wasn't much easier to make out easier. Unclear grading policy, and the TAs weren't very helpful. You have to teach yourself everything.

She has a whole script of what she wants to say every class, so if you're running short on time, she'll just throw everything at you quickly before the class ends. Not a hard class, but very easy to mess up and get a bad grade. Very nice grading curve, though (25% A, 25% AB, 25% B).
Try to stay awake. I dare you

if you have taken statistic class before, you'll do fine in this class. organize your lecture notes and do all the homework. she write everything she said, so if you don't  grab the concept in class, the notes are your savior. discussion is not helpful. exams are identical to homework and she's a generous grader.

-Be prepared to know how to use a program called "R"  -If you go to lecture everyday you will pass (I have never taken a stats class before) -She has a very generous curve, 77% of kids got a B or better!!   -If you need 1 stats class, take this -The practice tests are very similar to the exams -TA NOT helpful, I didn't go to discussion

A lot of the reviews here are critical of Professor Li, but I absolutely loved her class and teaching. Lectures are crucial to go to. You will take a lot of notes--so make them good and organized. It will help immensely for the exams. She always gives practice exams with examples that are very much like the real thing. Very helpful, nice and smart.

Everything you need to know: Lectures are very fast, homework can be a handful at times, there are a billion concepts to know, discussions aren't worth going to, she will do very little explaining of things, tests are tough but doable if you have the concepts down because she allows an extra full page of paper (both sides) for notes on each exam.

Unless you have taken statistics before, you will have a hard time with Sijing.  She goes a million miles a minute with little explanation.  Uses language that can be very confusing, and sometimes was little help when asked questions.  Very smart lady but not a great teacher.
Very unclear and confusing. Would not recommend
